document_title: What is Herpes? Common causes and symptoms
subsection_content:
Herpes simplex virus – symbol HSV; is a strain of virus that causes skin herpes, commonly found in the mouth and genitals, less commonly on the trunk or limbs. (first)
Many people live with HSV for years without experiencing symptoms. This means that the person has been infected with the virus for a long time but has never had a herpes outbreak.
In the vast majority of cases, people infected with the Herpes virus have blisters on the lips, around the mouth and on the genitals. Herpes can also appear on the fingers, hands and some other parts of the body of people infected with the Herpes virus.
Herpes simplex virus is a strain of virus that causes skin herpes
Sexual contact is one of the common routes of HSV transmission, but not the only one. Herpes virus can still spread from person to person through many methods. Herpes is a relatively common disease, people with Herpes should not feel ashamed of their condition.
The World Health Organization estimates:
About 67% of the world's population under 50 years of age has oral or genital HSV-1.; About 13% of people between the ages of 15 and 49 have HSV-2.
Several other studies show that more than 90% of adults have HSV-1 antibodies by age 50. (2)
